bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to William Henry Welch, May 17, 1927

div1.p: Laura Carter sends Welch quotations expressing Henry Carter's final conclusions on L. icteroides.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to William Henry Welch, May 17, 1927

opener.dateline:
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
May 17, 1927.

div1.p:
As to Father's final conclusions in re L. icteroides, I
think that you may be interested in the two quotations herein
enclosed:
1: From Section 1, p. 5 of his History of Yellow Fever.
2: From the Transactions of the International Conference
on Health Problems in Tropical America, held at Kingston, Jamaica,
B. W. I., July 22 to August 1, 1924, pp. 211-212.

It was a great pleasure and privelege to see you the other
day. The inspiration of your presence will remain in my office
long after your all-too-brief visit!

With heartfelt good wishes for your summer's trip--and
for all other “times and undertakings.”
div1.closer: Most truly yours, Laura A. Carter 2 enclosures.
